body.p:
Assistant Surgeon Generals Office,
Louisville, Ky.
Dec. 12th 1863.
Sir,

In conformity with the wishes of the Governor of Kentucky as expressed in the inclosed communication, you will please consolidate the sick from Kentucky in the Hospitals under your direction and send them to this City, notifying the Medical Director here when they leave St. Louis.
This transfer will bring the men, in proximity to the theatre of operations in this section.

Respectfully,
Your Obedient Servant
(Signed:) R. C. Wood
Asst. Surgeon General
U. S. Army

Surgeon M. Mills U. S. A.
Med. Director, Dept. of the Missouri
St. Louis, Mo.

A true Copy
C C Gray
Asst. Surgeon U. S. A.

Asst. Surgeon General's Office
Louisville, Ky. Dec. 12th 1863.
R. C. Wood
Asst. Surgeon General
U. S. A.
Instructions to Med. Director Dept. of Missouri to transfer Kentucky soldiers in Hospitals of St. Louis, to Louisville, Ky.
Respectfully furnished for the information of His Excellency T. E. Bramlette, Governor of Kentucky.

R. C. Wood
Asst Surgeon General
U. S. Army
Ky S. G O.
Decr 12t. 63
